ch.unige.ng.species
Interface GeneFactory<T>

All Superinterfaces:
GlobalGeneFactory<T>
All Known Subinterfaces:
IntervalGeneFactory<T>, IStackGPGeneFactory<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractStackGPGeneFactory, BooleanGeneFactory, ByteGeneFactory, DoubleGeneFactory, IntegerGeneFactory, ProbabilityStackGPGeneFactory, SimpleStackGPGeneFactory
public interface GeneFactory<T>
extends GlobalGeneFactory<T>

A Genefactory determines the structure of an individual. An individual is a container and the gene factory creates the genes that are put into. If you want to implement this class, you have to be aware of some points:

  1. Two genes that are the same have to return the same hashCode, if this condition is not respected, it is possible that no speedup can be generated with the CachingPopulation

Version:
Each creation depend now on the position of the gene. We can now create some geneFactory that create a newgene depending on the position.
Author:
Jacques Fontignie

Methods inherited from interface ch.unige.ng.species.GlobalGeneFactory
getClassGene, setContext
 

Method Detail

newGene

T newGene(int position)
Returns:
a new Gene randomly chosen that will be at position position. Some geneFactories can create a newGene depending on the position.

randomGaussianValue

T randomGaussianValue(int position,
                      double mean,
                      double std)
The gene chosen at completely at Random using a gaussian distribution. This method does not make sense with any implementation, so the should not implement it, when it's not appropriate.

Parameters:
position - the Posiition of the gene that has to be created
mean - the gaussian distribution average
std - the gaussian distribution standard deviation

differentValue

T differentValue(int position,
                 T gene)
Parameters:
position - the position at which the gene has to be modified. This is important because it is possible that some mutation are depenedent of the position
gene -
Returns:
a gene different of gene randomly chosen
